intro: Physostigma mesoponticum var. baumii, commonly known as the Baumii variant of the Mesopontic physostigma, is a rare and distinctive plant native to specific regions of southern Europe. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring elongated, pendulous flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant thrives in well-drained, calcareous soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
